alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued March 28 at 6:52AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The Eastern Sierra Avalanche Center in Mammoth Lakes has issued a Backcountry Avalanche Watch for the following areas: the Eastern Sierra in Mono County and the Eastern Sierra in Inyo County * WHAT...The avalance danger is expected to rise to HIGH at all elevations by 7 am PDT Wednesday, March 29th. * WHERE...The eastern slopes of the Sierra Nevada mountain range between Virgina Lakes on the north to Bishop Creek on the south. * WHEN...In effect from 7 am Tuesday to 7 am PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Periods of very heavy snowfall and strong winds will create sensitive wind slabs and stress a weak upper snowpack. Travel will be difficult. Expect widespread areas of unstable snow. * PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Very dangerous avalanche conditions will develop overnight. Avalanches may break widely and run long distances and can run into mature forests, valley floors or flat terrain. Consult http://www.esavalanche.org or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County
